page.title: 13A SWANSEA SCHOOL EXCURSION
page.content: We left Brynhyfryd Junior on Monday morning and drove to Abercregan, where Mr. Bowen showed us the dormitories, classroom and dining room. We unpacked our clothes, collected packed lunches and walked the old mineral line to the site of the old Duffryn Colliery, now just a green slope down to the river. Back at the centre, we had tea then continued our work in the classroom. On Tuesday, we examined animal and insect life in the R.Afan and R.Cregan then studied coniferous trees on Pen Craig Isaf. On Wednesday, we completed a transect of Nant y Ban Forest then visited the Mining Museum at Afan Argoed. On Thursday, we visited the Lady Falls in the Neath Valley then walked the Argoed Trail. After packing and saying thank you to Mr. Bowen and the kitchen staff on Friday, we returned to Brynhyfryd.
